title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Good, The in-person interviews usually begin with a one-on-one interview with the hiring manager. During this initial meeting, the interviewer typically asks questions about the candidate's qualifications, skills, work history and relevant experience.
Interview Questions: Difficulties, Strengths, Strategies, and General questions

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 15min HR hiring manager interview. Invited to an in-person interview which was rescheduled 2 hours prior. Invited to a panel interview with 5 interviewers. In a large conference room with many applicants for various panels.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced conflict with a patient.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: asked a few questions regarding vent settings, abg, bipap setting. the normal clinical questions. director was really nice during the process. couple of questions regarding self motivation, how to handle situations
Interview Questions: what is your strongest asset

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Invited to interview in person. Never heard back and I followed up twice after the in- person interview. Not the best interview experience i've had. Questions were straight froward, two ladies were very nice but the man was not very kind.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you have changed a system to make it more effective?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Went to a hiring event- smooth process - met with nurse managers- met leadership- talked about my interests and openings available.  Answer some basic questions and reviewed salary expectations. Challenging work environment
Interview Questions:
why this organization?
what are you looking for?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two ladies in the OR for the new grad OR residency and it was very casual and friendly.  They gave me the information to set up an opportunity to shadow in the OR to make sure the position is right for me. Once I complete the shadowing experience I may be offered a position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in OR nursing? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process has changed since last year. Before they asked for a personal statement and for you to list your top choices of the available units. This time around they limited the units and chose which managers you were able to interview with. It was more of a hiring event versus scheduling and interview.
Interview Questions: Are you a morning person or a night owl?

title: RN Telemetry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and via Zoom. Made it to both rounds and they lasted about 30 minutes each. There were some technical difficulties, but that goes with any interview online. Overall a quick and easy process.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflict in the workplace?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: After completing application you receive an email to interview and select a date and time. Once you get to the interview location you sign in and then we’re walked back to a room to talk to the Nurse manager from the specialty you were selected for. Then they asked general questions about self and then questions about why the specialty.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this specialty?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was very nervous but interviewer was very conversational and easy to talk to. Answered any questions I had, and understanding of the lack of experience I had in the field.
Interview Questions: What did you learn as a new grad that will make you a good CNA? What areas did you struggle with.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: They wanted to know ME and what were my career goals and what i could bring to the hospital. I felt very comfortable because to me it didn't feel like a job interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
Time management. 
Why you want to be a CNA.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with two recommendation letters. Got a call from recruiter in several days and scheduled for an interview. The interview was very friendly and was more like a "get-to-know" meeting.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted via phone 2 weeks after to schedule a virtual interview. Interview took place a few days later. It was a quick and easy process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward. Met in a room with other candidates. Questions were easy personality-based questions. They gave you the opportunity to interview for multiple floors at once so they would have several managers present.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do on your off time?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for ICU. Interviewers were friendly and open. There were two of them, interviewing one candidate at a time in 30 minute time slots. I think it was one long day of holding interviews for all candidates. Vibe was more of a get-to-know-you vibe. It was held in a large computer room where other units were interviewing candidates too.
Interview Questions: name a time when you handled a patient who was deteriorating, 3 adjectives to describe you, talk about conflict resolution

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Entered a waiting room and had to check in when arrived. After your time slot was open or the person you are interviewing was available we were lead outside to some tables. After the interview, you had to check out.
Interview Questions: Why Fountain Valley?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Checked in at the front desk and then escorted to the interview waiting area. Staff members were audibly chatting about applicants in the waiting area. Interviewed with more than one person in a single session. Was asked 7-10 generic behavioral questions before being prompted to conclude the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me when you had a difference in opinion with someone and how was it handled?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position online in December of 2018. I received a call from a recruiter mid-January (2019) who told me that I have an interview on February 7th at 8:30am. He didn’t tell me with who or which department. When I arrived, there was another girl who was dressed up in interview attire looking for the conference room, so I approached her. We made small talk as we walked to the conference room. She asked me which unit I was interviewing for and I said I had no idea. She said that she received an email explaining who she would be interviewing with and which specific unit. I thought it was weird that I didn’t receive an email or additional information. Turns out, I was interviewing for the ER (my #1 unit of choice). It would have been nice to know that beforehand so I could’ve prepared better!! The interview wasn’t too bad. They asked personality/characteristic questions to make sure you have what it takes to work in the ER.
Interview Questions: Do you get attached easily?

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview is about 10-15 minutes long. Questions are asked about the therapeutic diets in the hospital. The patient services manager asks the same questions to every applicant. The interview process is fast and easy.
Interview Questions: Make three foods a renal patient cannot have!

title: ER RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then got a call for an interview a month later. Was interviewed by the ER director and manager. They asked me 3 questions and then hired me after talking amongst themselves a few minutes after the interview had concluded.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Telemetry RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple and straightforward, in that no "tricky" questions were asked.  The typical questions, such as your greatest strengths and weaknesses, were asked.  Other questions were, where do you see yourself in five years.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest weaknesses?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: submitted application online and had 1 interview with the manager, after the interview i was asked to submit a drug test on campus with a testing nurse. once i passed the test they took my photo at HR and a pictured badge was given to me the same day.
Interview Questions: Are you fluent in any other language?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with main Supervisor & Dept Head.  Both were rather sketchy in attitude, seemed cold, reserved, and couldn't pin down any answers to questions regarding the position.  Very vague about job and dept areas of job.
Interview Questions: How would I deal with people vomiting, spitting up, body fluids, and various smells while working?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center (Fountain Valley, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple and pleasant. Manager wanted to know what my past perioperative experience was and how I thought I could add or improve the processes at this facility. She was very personable and through, and asked if I would be willing or able to participate in any in services that may be planned in the future for the staff.
Interview Questions: Explain my experience in working at two trauma centers in the past.
